get.description: Returns the current API exposable Fidesops configuration.

schema.title: Response Get Config Api V1 Config Get

get.description: Returns all connection configurations in the database.

put.description:
Given a list of connection config data elements, create or update corresponding ConnectionConfig objects
or report failure

If the key in the payload exists, it will be used to update an existing ConnectionConfiguration.
Otherwise, a new ConnectionConfiguration will be created for you.

Note that ConnectionConfiguration.secrets are not updated through this endpoint.

get.description: Returns connection configuration with matching key.

delete.description: Removes the connection configuration with matching key.

put.description:
Update secrets that will be used to connect to a specified connection_type.

The specific secrets will be connection-dependent. For example, the components needed to connect to a Postgres DB
will differ from Dynamo DB.

get.description: Endpoint to test a connection at any time using the saved configuration secrets.

put.description:
Run validations against a dataset without attempting to save it to the database.

Checks that:
- all required fields are present, all field values are valid types
- all DataCategory values reference known keys
- etc.

After validating, also tests to see if the dataset is traversable. Note that
it's possible for a dataset to be valid but not traversable; this happens
when a dataset is dependent on references to other datasets.

Returns a 200 OK for all valid datasets, and a traversal_details object with
information about the traversal (or traversal errors).

get.description: Returns all datasets in the database.

put.description:
Given a list of dataset elements, create or update corresponding Dataset objects
or report failure

Use for bulk creating and/or updating datasets.

If the fides_key for a given dataset exists, it will be treated as an update.
Otherwise, a new dataset will be created.

get.description: Returns a single dataset based on the given key.

delete.description: Removes the dataset based on the given key.

schema.title: Response Get Encryption Key Api V1 Cryptography Encryption Key Get

put.description: Masks the value provided using the provided masking strategy

get.description: Lists available masking strategies with instructions on how to use them

schema.title: Response List Masking Strategies Api V1 Masking Strategy Get

post.description:
Given a set of credentials, returns an access token if they are correct. Raises 401
exception if not
Creates a new client and returns the credentials

delete.description:
Deletes the client associated with the client_id. Does nothing if the client does
not exist

get.description: Returns a list of the scopes associated with the client. Returns an empty list if client does not exist.

schema.title: Response Get Client Scopes Api V1 Oauth Client  Client Id  Scope Get

put.description: Overwrites the client's scopes with those provided. Does nothing if the client doesn't exist

get.description: Returns a list of all scopes available for assignment in the system

schema.title: Response Read Scopes Api V1 Oauth Scope Get

get.description: Return a paginated list of all Policy records in this system

put.description:
Given a list of policy data elements, create or update corresponding Policy objects
or report failure

Given a list of Rule data elements, create or update corresponding Rule objects
or report failure

Given a list of Rule data elements, create corresponding Rule objects
or report failure

get.description:
Returns PrivacyRequest information. Supports a variety of optional query params.

To fetch a single privacy request, use the id query param `?id=`.
To see individual execution logs, use the verbose query param `?verbose=True`.

post.description:
Given a list of privacy request data elements, create corresponding PrivacyRequest objects
or report failure and execute them within the FidesOps system.

You cannot update privacy requests after they've been created.

get.description: Returns all the execution logs associated with a given privacy request ordered by updated asc.

put.description: Returns dry run queries given a list of dataset ids

schema.title: Response Get Request Preview Queries Api V1 Privacy Request Preview Put

post.description:
Uploads data from a SAR to specified storage destination.
Returns location of data.

put.description:
Given a list of storage destination elements, create or update corresponding StorageConfig objects
or report failure.
Add or update secrets for storage config.

get.description: Retrieves configs for storage by key.

AccessLevel.title: AccessLevel
AccessLevel.description:
Perms given to the ConnectionConfig.  For example, with "read" permissions, fides-ops promises
to not modify the data on a connected application database in any way.

"Write" perms mean we can update/delete items in the connected database.

AccessToken.title: AccessToken
AccessToken.description: A wrapper for the access_code returned upon successful authentication

ActionType.title: ActionType
ActionType.description: The purpose of a particular privacy request

AesDecryptionRequest.title: AesDecryptionRequest
AesDecryptionRequest.description: Specifies fields provided to the AES Decryption endpoint

AesDecryptionResponse.title: AesDecryptionResponse
AesDecryptionResponse.description: Specified fields returned from the AES Decryption endpoint

AesEncryptionRequest.title: AesEncryptionRequest
AesEncryptionRequest.description: Specifies fields provided to the AES Encryption endpoint

AesEncryptionResponse.title: AesEncryptionResponse
AesEncryptionResponse.description: Specifies fields returned from the AES Encryption endpoint

BulkPostPrivacyRequests.description: Schema with mixed success/failure responses for Bulk Create of PrivacyRequest responses.

BulkPutConnectionConfiguration.title: BulkPutConnectionConfiguration
BulkPutConnectionConfiguration.description: Schema with mixed success/failure responses for Bulk Create/Update of ConnectionConfiguration responses.

BulkPutDataset.description: Schema with mixed success/failure responses for Bulk Create/Update of Datasets.

BulkPutPolicyResponse.title: BulkPutPolicyResponse
BulkPutPolicyResponse.description: Schema with mixed success/failure responses for Bulk Create/Update of Policy responses.

BulkPutRuleResponse.title: BulkPutRuleResponse
BulkPutRuleResponse.description: Schema with mixed success/failure responses for Bulk Create/Update of Rule responses.

BulkPutRuleTargetResponse.title: BulkPutRuleTargetResponse
BulkPutRuleTargetResponse.description: Schema with mixed success/failure responses for Bulk Create/Update of RuleTarget responses.

BulkPutStorageConfigResponse.title: BulkPutStorageConfigResponse
BulkPutStorageConfigResponse.description: Schema with mixed success/failure responses for Bulk Create/Update of StorageConfig.

BulkUpdateFailed.title: BulkUpdateFailed
BulkUpdateFailed.description: Schema for use when Bulk Create/Update fails.

CollectionAddressResponse.description: Schema for the representation of a collection in the graph

ConnectionConfigurationResponse.title: ConnectionConfigurationResponse
ConnectionConfigurationResponse.description:
Describes the returned schema for a ConnectionConfiguration.

Do *NOT* add "secrets" to this schema.

ConnectionType.title: ConnectionType
ConnectionType.description: Supported types to which we can connect fides-ops.

CreateConnectionConfiguration.title: CreateConnectionConfiguration
CreateConnectionConfiguration.description:
Schema for creating a ConnectionConfiguration

Note that secrets are *NOT* allowed to be supplied here.

DataUpload.title: DataUpload
DataUpload.description: A wrapper for the data upload location returned upon successful upload

DatasetTraversalDetails.title: DatasetTraversalDetails
DatasetTraversalDetails.description:
Describes whether or not the parent dataset is traversable; if not, includes
an error message describing the traversal issues.

DryRunDatasetResponse.title: DryRunDatasetResponse
DryRunDatasetResponse.description: Response model for dataset dry run

ExecutionLogDetailResponse.title: ExecutionLogDetailResponse
ExecutionLogDetailResponse.description: Schema for the detailed ExecutionLogs when accessed directly

ExecutionLogResponse.title: ExecutionLogResponse
ExecutionLogResponse.description: Schema for the embedded ExecutionLogs associated with a PrivacyRequest

ExecutionLogStatus.title: ExecutionLogStatus
ExecutionLogStatus.description: Enum for execution log statuses, reflecting where they are in their workflow

FidesopsCollectionMeta.title: FidesopsCollectionMeta
FidesopsCollectionMeta.description: Collection-level fidesops-specific annotations used for query traversal

fides_key.description: A unique key used to identify this resource.

organization_fides_key.title: Organization Fides Key

name.title: Name

description.description: In-depth description of what this resource is.

FidesopsDatasetCollection.description: Overrides fideslang DatasetCollection model with additional Fidesops annotations

FidesopsDatasetMeta.title: FidesopsDatasetMeta
FidesopsDatasetMeta.description: "Dataset-level fidesops-specific annotations used for query traversal

FidesopsDatasetReference.description: Reference to a field from another Collection

FidesopsMeta.description: Fidesops-specific annotations used for query traversal

FieldsAffectedResponse.description: Schema detailing the individual fields affected by a particular query detailed in the ExecutionLog

FormatPreservationConfig.title: FormatPreservationConfig
FormatPreservationConfig.description: option to preserve format in masking

MaskingAPIResponse.title: MaskingAPIResponse
MaskingAPIResponse.description: The API Response returned upon masking completion

MaskingStrategyConfigurationDescription.title: MaskingStrategyConfigurationDescription
MaskingStrategyConfigurationDescription.description: The description model for a specific configuration in a masking strategy

MaskingStrategyDescription.title: MaskingStrategyDescription
MaskingStrategyDescription.description: The description model for a masking strategy

Policy.title: Policy
Policy.description: An external representation of a FidesOps Policy

PolicyMaskingSpec.title: PolicyMaskingSpec
PolicyMaskingSpec.description: Models the masking strategy definition int the policy document

PolicyMaskingSpecResponse.title: PolicyMaskingSpecResponse
PolicyMaskingSpecResponse.description:
The schema to use when returning a masking strategy via the API. This schema omits other
potentially sensitive fields in the masking configuration, for example the encryption
algorithm.

PolicyResponse.title: PolicyResponse
PolicyResponse.description: A holistic view of a Policy record, including all foreign keys by default.

PrivacyRequestCreate.title: PrivacyRequestCreate
PrivacyRequestCreate.description: Data required to create a PrivacyRequest

PrivacyRequestResponse.description: Schema to check the status of a PrivacyRequest

PrivacyRequestStatus.description: Enum for privacy request statuses, reflecting where they are in the Privacy Request Lifecycle

PrivacyRequestVerboseResponse.description: The schema for the more detailed PrivacyRequest response containing detailed execution logs.

RuleCreate.title: RuleCreate
RuleCreate.description:
The schema to use when creating a Rule. This schema accepts a storage_destination_key
over a composite object.

RuleResponse.title: RuleResponse
RuleResponse.description:
The schema to use when returning a Rule via the API. This schema uses a censored version
of the `PolicyMaskingSpec` that omits the configuration to avoid exposing secrets.

RuleTarget.title: RuleTarget
RuleTarget.description: An external representation of a Rule's target DataCategory within a Fidesops Policy

StorageDetailsLocal.description: The details required to configurate local storage configuration

StorageDetailsOneTrust.title: StorageDetailsOneTrust
StorageDetailsOneTrust.description: The details required to represent a OneTrust storage configuration.

StorageDetailsS3.title: StorageDetailsS3
StorageDetailsS3.description: The details required to represent an AWS S3 storage bucket.

ValidateDatasetResponse.title: ValidateDatasetResponse
ValidateDatasetResponse.description:
Response model for validating a dataset, which includes both the dataset
itself (if valid) plus a details object describing if the dataset is
traversable or not.
